tournament.name: Thursday 5th Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing a control strategy with a Bant color combination to consistently disrupt the opponent while generating card advantage and value. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, along with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Aether Gust. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value by blinking permanents for additional triggers. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent through card advantage and strong threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while using Yorion as a companion to generate additional value by flickering permanents. It aims to manipulate the opponent's resources and disrupt their strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon. The deck's consistency and resilience come from its versatile card selection and mana base, allowing it to adapt to various situations and outvalue opponents in the long game.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to add consistency and value to the deck. By combining control elements with powerful threats like Agent of Treachery and Shark Typhoon, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure victory. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to maximize damage output quickly by utilizing aggressive Rakdos creatures and sacrificing synergies. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion amplifies the damage dealt by odd-costed creatures. Cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Claim the Firstborn allow for efficient creature removal and incremental damage. The deck also includes cards like Witch's Oven and Woe Strider for sacrifice synergy, providing additional value and board control. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient aggression and strategic sacrificing.

The deck focuses on disruption and removal spells to control the game, while also utilizing cards like Teferi and Tamiyo for card advantage and protection. The deck also includes powerful late-game threats like Agent of Treachery and Uro to win the game once it stabilizes. Yorion as a companion allows for extra value with flickering enters-the-battlefield effects. The mana base is built to support the varied color requirements of the spells in the deck, ensuring consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through control and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and outvalue the opponent through card advantage and powerful threats. The deck utilizes a companion in Yorion, Sky Nomad to create a 80-card deck, allowing for more consistency and flexibility in longer games. The deck is packed with powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Shatter the Sky, and Elspeth Conquers Death to answer threats and generate value. It also runs cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon to apply pressure and close out games. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outgrind the opponent for victory.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing various powerful control spells and card advantage engines to outvalue opponents. With the help of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt opposing strategies while generating card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. The deck's win condition often comes in the form of Shark Typhoon tokens or taking control of opponent's creatures with Agent of Treachery, backed up by board wipes like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death to keep the battlefield under control.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game and outvalue the opponent through card advantage. This is achieved by utilizing a mix of counter spells, card draw, and removal to disrupt the opponent's plans while maintaining a steady stream of cards. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Agent of Treachery, while also utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value and flexibility. The deck also incorporates a variety of temples and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shatter the Sky. The goal is to create a resource advantage and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and large threats like Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for extra value. The deck utilizes a mix of control elements and powerful finishers to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to utilize the Cycling mechanic to quickly cycle through cards while dealing damage and gaining advantage. By cycling cards and utilizing cards like Zenith Flare, Improbable Alliance, and Valiant Rescuer, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats and card advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing players to recast key cycling cards from their graveyard. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of cycling cards and aggressive creatures to maintain pressure on opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and deal damage efficiently. By utilizing the Companion Obosh, the Preypiercer, all odd-costed creatures in the deck receive a significant power boost, increasing the deck's damage output. With a mix of low-cost creatures like Gutterbones and Serrated Scorpion, along with powerful threats like Rotting Regisaur and Hunted Nightmare, this Mono Black Aggro deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies with cards like Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Dreadhorde Butcher to apply pressure early on. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provides additional value through its escape ability, while Claim the Firstborn allows for stealing opposing threats. The goal is to maintain a steady stream of sacrifices and aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.
